It was released on October 24, 2006, by [[Jive Records]] as the second single from the album. The song features American rapper [[T.I.]] and was co-written by Timberlake, [[Timbaland]], [[Danja (musician)|Nate "Danja" Hills]], and [[T.I.]], and produced by Timberlake, Timbaland, and Danja. Timberlake revealed that the song's creating process took time to imagine and execute. He also stated that "My Love" was less about marriage and a more humble approach to love. The song features synthesizer chords with a slow beat and includes a [[beatboxing]], [[Percussion instrument|percussion]], and [[staccato]] sounds. Timberlake described the track as "a rock-techno ballad". The track reached number one on the US [[Billboard Hot 100|''Billboard'' Hot 100]], being Timberlake's second consecutive single to do so. Among other ''Billboard'' magazine's charts, it also topped the [[Mainstream Top 40]], [[Hot Dance Airplay]], and [[Hot Digital Songs]] charts. Internationally, the single peaked in the number two position on the [[UK Singles Chart]], becoming Timberlake's fourth single to do so. In New Zealand, the track peaked at number one for five non-consecutive weeks, to become Timberlake's second number one single. [[Pitchfork Media]] named "My Love" as their number one song of 2006. Many have cited that the song was a sequel to Timberlake's 2002 song "[[Cry Me a River (Justin Timberlake song)|Cry Me a River]]". The track won [[Grammy Award for Best Rap/Sung Collaboration|Best Rap/Sung Collaboration]] at the [[49th Grammy Awards|2007 Grammy Awards]]. "My Love" also won Timberlake the Male Artist of the Year and Best Choreography in a Video at the [[2007 MTV Video Music Awards]]. ==Background== In December 2005, Timberlake began working on his second album, ''[[FutureSex/LoveSounds]]'', the follow-up to ''[[Justified (album)|Justified]]'' (2002). Within three weeks, "My Love" was one of several songs that were recorded.{{cite news|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/news/story/11514699/cover_story_justin_timberlake_revs_up_his_sex_machine/5|title=Justin Timberlake Revs Up His Sex Machine|last=Scaggs|first=Austin|date=2006-09-06|work=[[Rolling Stone]]|page=5|accessdate=2009-05-16}} In September 2006, Timberlake told ''[[Rolling Stone]]'' that the song was "a hip-hop ballad" and that the process of creating "took two hours to imagine and execute". While promoting the album in an interview with [[MTV News]], Timberlake revealed that the second half of the album (including "My Love") focuses on anthems of love. In another interview, he revealed that "My Love" was a "contradiction of sounds. You've got this operatic thing going on. If you take all the [[staccato]] sounds out, the essence of the song is it's a ballad, but the way the beat is inlaid underneath the vocals, it becomes a percussive ballad."{{cite journal|first=Jon|last=Breamu|title=Justin time — Timberlake gets in sync with his sexy side on new beat-driven CD|date=2006-09-21|work=Ventura County Star}} In discussion of [[T.I.]]'s participation in the track, Timberlake said: "The second hook finished and I said, 'Oh, a rapper would sound good on this'."{{cite news|url=http://www.mtv.com/music/the_leak/justin_timberlake/futuresexlovesounds/index.jhtml|title=Justin Timberlake Launches New Album|last=Ganz|first=Caryn|author2=John Norris|date=2006-09-12|publisher=[[MTV News]]|accessdate=2009-05-20}} Timbaland, who co-wrote and produced the song, agreed to the idea and suggested T.I. Timberlake agreed to the idea, although he doubted that T.I. would say yes, and said that he was thankful that T.I. agreed to take part. Timberlake revealed in 2013 that he originally asked rapper [[Jay Z|JAY-Z]] (Whom he would collaborate with extensively in his later career) to appear on the track before T.I. "I wanted to do a record with him on ''FutureSex/LoveSounds'' ..." he explained "...and he at that time had done a record with [[Beyoncé]], it was '[[Déjà Vu (Beyoncé song)|Déjà Vu]].' And he said—respectfully, I can't knock him for saying like I have this one feature, I think he was working on his own music as well so he didn't want to be on too many things. And I said, 'I totally respect that. I'm obviously not gonna get into any domestic anything. That's your wife.' But the record was 'My Love.' And it ended up being an interesting blessing in disguise because I thank Tip for that record—I mean his verse is phenomenal."{{cite web|url=http://www.hiphopdx.com/index/news/id.25244/title.justin-timberlake-says-jay-z-was-approached-before-t-i-for-my-love-collaboration|title=Justin Timberlake Says Jay Z Was Approached Before T.I. For "My Love" Collaboration|author=HipHopDX|date=28 August 2013|work=HipHopDX|access-date=17 April 2015|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150417142005/http://www.hiphopdx.com/index/news/id.25244/title.justin-timberlake-says-jay-z-was-approached-before-t-i-for-my-love-collaboration|archive-date=17 April 2015|url-status=dead}} ==Music and lyrics== {{listen|filename=Justin Timberlake (feat. Timbaland) - My Love.ogg|title="My Love" |description=The music of "My Love" is built around a stuttering sounding trance-style [[synthesizer]].|format=[[Ogg]]}} "My Love" is a [[contemporary R&B|R&B]] and [[hip hop music|hip hop]] ballad.{{cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2007/02/09/arts/music/09timb.html?_r=1|title=He's Bringing Commitment Back (and Not in a Box)|last=Michel|first=Sia|date=2007-02-09|work=[[The New York Times]]|accessdate=2009-05-21}}{{cite web|url=http://www.complex.com/music/2013/03/the-25-best-justin-timberlake-songs/|title=The 25 Best Justin Timberlake Songs|author=Lauren Nostro|date=15 March 2013|work=Complex|accessdate=15 January 2016}} The song is composed in the key of [[E minor]], with a chord progression of [[E minor|E-minor]]-[[B-minor]]-[[A-minor]]. It is set in [[time signature]] of [[common time]] with a [[tempo]] of 121 [[beats per minute]].{{cite web|url=http://www.musicnotes.com/sheetmusic/mtd.asp?ppn=MN0056661|title=Justin Timberlake Digital Sheet Music: My Love|publisher=Musicnotes|accessdate=2009-05-19}} The song is composed with a [[Noise gate|stuttering]] trance-style [[synthesizer]]. It also includes Timbaland beatboxing and adding "toy sounds", as well as Timberlake's [[falsetto]]. The track features a rap verse from rapper T.I.{{cite news|url=http://top40.about.com/od/singles/gr/mylove.htm|title=Justin Timberlake featuring T.I. - My Love|last=Lamb|first=Bill|publisher=Top 40|accessdate=2009-05-19|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090214205649/http://top40.about.com/od/singles/gr/mylove.htm|archive-date=2009-02-14|url-status=dead}}{{cite journal|first=Nekesa Mumbi|last=Moody|title=Dear Mr. President: There were some crazy songs this year|date=2006-12-31|work=[[Columbia Daily Tribune]]}} It also carries a slower beat, with an electro-Southern hip hop sound.{{cite news|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1539749/20060829/timberlake_justin.jhtml|title=Justin's Album Shows Off Two Sides: Over-The-Top Saucy, Unassumingly Sweet|last=Vineyard|first=Jennifer|date=2006-08-29|publisher=[[MTV News]]|accessdate=2009-05-16}} ''[[The Guardian]]'' described the song as a "languid love ballad, prickling with dark emotion",{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/music/2006/jul/14/justintimberlake|title=Observermail preview: Justin Timberlake interview|date=2006-07-14|work=[[The Guardian]]|publisher=[[The Observer|The Observer Music Monthly]]|accessdate=2009-05-17|format=[[Internet Archive]]}} while MTV News described the [[beat (music)|beat]] as "slow and saucy".{{cite news|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1538469/20060814/timberlake_justin.jhtml|title=Justin Previews New Tracks At Hollywood Show With Help From Will.I.Am, Timbaland|last=Byrne|first=Katie|date=2006-08-14|publisher=[[MTV News]]|accessdate=2009-05-16}} Ben Williams of ''[[New York (magazine)|New York]]'' magazine wrote that it has "stabbing techno riff, crunched-together mouth-popping noises, and wailing opera singer".{{cite news|url=http://nymag.com/arts/popmusic/reviews/20314/|title=The Men Who Would Be Prince|last=Williams|first=Ben|date=2006-09-11|work=[[New York (magazine)|New York]]|accessdate=2009-05-17}} Alexis Petridis of ''The Guardian'' said that the single is "a twitching mass of rave synthesizers and [agonizingly] slow beats".{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/music/2006/sep/08/popandrock.shopping8|title=Justin Timberlake, FutureSex/LoveSounds|last=Petridis|first=Alexis|date=2006-09-08|work=[[The Guardian]]|publisher=[[guardian.co.uk]]|accessdate=2009-05-16}} Jacqui Swift of ''[[The Sun (United Kingdom)|The Sun]]'' wrote that the song "begins with a tinny percussion sound before launching into a frantic repetitive chorus".{{cite journal|first=Jacqui|last=Swift|title=Justin's new king of pop — Something for the weekend|date=2006-09-08|work=[[The Sun (United Kingdom)|The Sun]]|page=56}} In July 2006, ''[[The Observer|The Observer Music Monthly]]'' interviewed Timberlake and stated that the track "is arguably the album's 'Cry Me a River'." In response, Timberlake said, "It is similar. You go back to [[Aaliyah]]'s biggest record, '[[Are You That Somebody?|Are You That Somebody]]' – it's similar to that too because it's that percussive ballad." When asked about the lyrics, "There's just one thing I need from you: say I do", being [[Justin Timberlake#Personal life|autobiographical]], he said no, adding that the line before that, "this ring here represents my heart", is about marriage and love. Timberlake stated, "It's not specifically about marriage, but about a humble approach to love. None of it is autobiographical, though obviously I have experience to draw from." Williams stated that the song is "an obvious sequel" to Timberlake's 2002 song "[[Cry Me a River (Justin Timberlake song)|Cry Me a River]]". ''[[The Georgia Straight]]'''s Martin Turenne interprets the song's background as Timberlake lowering himself on bended knee, proposing long walks on the beach and asking, "Would you date me on the regular?".{{cite news|url=https://www.straight.com/timberlake-strangely-ladylike?# |title=Timberlake strangely ladylike |last=Turenne |first=Martin |date=2006-09-14 |work=[[The Georgia Straight]] |accessdate=2009-05-16 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121016050549/http://www.straight.com/timberlake-strangely-ladylike |archivedate=2012-10-16 }} Dagny Salas of ''[[North by Northwestern]]'' considered it a more romantic song, about Timberlake professing his love to a woman.{{cite news|url=http://www.northbynorthwestern.com/2006/10/340/album-review-of-justin-timberlakes-futuresexlovesounds/|title=Album Review of Justin Timberlake's Northwestern]]|accessdate=2009-05-18|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20071105231850/http://www.northbynorthwestern.com/2006/10/340/album-review-of-justin-timberlakes-futuresexlovesounds/|archive-date=2007-11-05|url-status=dead}} Others have opined that "My Love" is a marriage proposal.{{cite news|url=http://media.www.thejusticeonline.com/media/storage/paper573/news/2006/09/12/Arts/On.The.Record.Justin.Timberlake.John.Mayer.The.Rapture-2267374.shtml|archive-url=https://archive.today/20110728100216/http://media.www.thejusticeonline.com/media/storage/paper573/news/2006/09/12/Arts/On.The.Record.Justin.Timberlake.John.Mayer.The.Rapture-2267374.shtml|url-status=dead|archive-date=2011-07-28|title=On the Record: Justin Timberlake, John Mayer, The Rapture|last=Fischer|first=Jonathan|date=2006-09-12|work=[[Brandeis University|The Justice]]|page=1|accessdate=2009-05-17}} ==Critical reception== {{Quote box|width=300px|align=right|quote="A sort of hip-hop ballad with the inclusion of T.I.'s verse, this song crosses more than a few genre boundaries and was well-received. In typical Justin fashion, this track is smothered with falsetto notes that all come together to tell us a dreamy love tale."|source=—''[[Complex (magazine)|Complex]]'' staff in 2013.{{Cite news |url=http://www.complex.com/music/2013/03/the-25-best-justin-timberlake-songs/justin-timberlake-like-i-love-you |title=The 25 Best Justin Timberlake Songs |date=March 15, 2013 |work=Complex |access-date=June 18, 2017}}}} In ''[[The New York Times]]'' review of the album, critic [[Kelefa Sanneh]] wrote: "...'My Love', a sumptuous collaboration with the rapper T.I. It starts with a 90-second 'prelude', a clattering rhythm track with a bit of rapping and snippets of melody. Then the real thing hits: sleek synthesizer chords punctuated by tiny bursts of silence."{{cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2006/09/11/arts/music/11choi.html?_r=2&oref=slogin&ref=music&pagewanted=all|title=New CD's|date=2006-09-11|work=[[The New York Times]]|accessdate=2009-05-17}} Sal Cinquemani of [[Slant Magazine]] wrote that the track "mixes Timberlake's proud beatboxing talent with colossal, futuristic synth swirls and a cartoonish, maniacal giggle that's looped ad infinitum a la the crying baby from [[Aaliyah]]'s '[[Are You That Somebody]]?'".{{cite news|url=http://www.slantmagazine.com/music/music_review.asp?ID=957|title=Justin Timberlake — FutureSex/LoveSounds|last=Cinquemani|first=Sal|date=2006-09-05|work=[[Slant (magazine)|Slant]]|accessdate=2009-05-18|url-status=dead|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130627112818/http://www.slantmagazine.com/music/music_review.asp?ID=957|archivedate=2013-06-27}} Matthew Gasteier of ''Prefix'' magazine noted that the song "is probably the standout triumph here, with stuttering synths and a fade-in-fade-out shimmering beat that may be the best ever from Timbaland".{{cite news|url=http://www.prefixmag.com/reviews/justin-timberlake/futuresexlovesounds/15422/|title=Justin Timberlake — FutureSex/LoveSounds|last=Gasteier|first=Matthew|date=2006-09-12|work=Prefix|accessdate=2009-05-17}} Lauren Murphy of [[entertainment.ie]] stated that the single is "undeniably fluid and features some of the niftiest slo-mo effects around".{{cite news|url=http://entertainment.ie/album-review/Justin-Timberlake---FutureSex/LoveSounds/4678.htm|title=Justin Timberlake — FutureSex/LoveSounds|last=Murphy|first=Lauren|date=2006-09-19|publisher=[[entertainment.ie]]|accessdate=2009-05-18}} Jonah Weiner of ''[[Blender (magazine)|Blender]]'' magazine cited the song as the "standout" song from the album and wrote that the single "...straddles the album's up-tempo ''FutureSex'' and balladeering ''LoveSounds'' halves — one coos about puppy love over the other's stroboscopic, salivating beat, and both trade devotionals on the chorus".{{cite news|url=http://www.blender.com/guide/new/54309/futuresexlovesounds.html|title=FutureSex/LoveSounds|last=Weiner|first=John|date=2006-09-12|work=[[Blender (magazine)|Blender]]|accessdate=2009-05-18}} {{Dead link|date=April 2012|bot=H3llBot}} "My Love" was criticized for some of the lyrics and sounds that were featured. Sanneh reported that Timberlake "exhales his clumsy pickup lines" with the lyrics "If I told you you were beautiful / Would you date me on the regular?". Murphy contemplated that the song is "ultimately ruined" by a "bizarre [[Crazy Frog]]-meets-Laughing-Policeman underlay". Emily Vaughan of ''North by Northwestern'' commented that Timberlake claims to have gone around the world twice in "My Love" and "Damn Girl" and that he is also "running out of creative ways to say he would like you to go to bed with him". Vaughan, however, was positive towards "My Love", stating that the song, along with "[[What Goes Around ... / ... Comes Around]]", sounded considerably different from the rest of the album. [[VH1]]'s Emily Exton in a 2013 article said that in the song Timberlake "reinvents mainstream pop music and increases his artistic credibility at the same time. The song is more sonically futuristic than others."{{Cite news |url=http://www.vh1.com/news/51659/justin-timberlake-greatest-songs/ |title=Let The Groove Get In: Justin Timberlake's 20 Greatest Songs |date=October 4, 2013 |work=VH1 |access-date=June 21, 2017}} In an article about Timberlake's catalogue in 2016, [[Idolator (website)|Idolator]] staff stated the song "is one of the foundational texts of the [[Alternative R&B|PBR&B]] explosion of the 2010s," also noting the track's cyborg theremin wails, slo-mo rave synths and a frail falsetto "it's the midpoint between the space futurism of [[Aaliyah]] and [[Ginuwine]]'s hits, and the robo-blues that would emerge with ''[[808s & Heartbreak]]''." They concluded saying that since the "narcotized" music became a chart-topper, it opened the door for artists like [[The Weeknd]] "to hit big with something as sinister as "[[The Hills (song)|The Hills]]" nearly a decade later."{{Cite news |url=http://www.idolator.com/7634013/justin-timberlake-nsync-biggest-songs-reviewed-playlist-listen/6 |title=Justin Timberlake's 23 Top 10 Singles (Including *NSYNC!): Revisited, Reviewed & Ranked |date=May 20, 2016 |work=Idolator |access-date=June 21, 2017}} ===Accolades=== The song was picked by [[Pitchfork Media]] as their number one song of 2006,{{cite news|url=http://pitchfork.com/features/staff-lists/6508-the-top-100-tracks-of-2006/10/|title=The Top 100 Tracks of 2006|last=Macia|first=Peter|date=2006-12-18|publisher=[[Pitchfork Media]]|page=10|accessdate=2009-05-18}} also ranking the song at 26 on "The Top 500 Tracks of the 2000s."{{cite web | url=http://pitchfork.com/features/lists-and-guides/7692-the-top-500-tracks-of-the-2000s-50-21/?page=3 | title=The Top 500 Tracks of the 2000s | work=Pitchfork Media | accessdate=April 26, 2016 | author=August 19, 2009}} "At the [[49th Grammy Awards]], "My Love" won a Grammy Award in the category of [[Grammy Award for Best Rap/Sung Collaboration|Best Rap/Sung Collaboration]].{{cite news|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1604468/20090206/t_i_.jhtml|title=T.I. Talks Grammy Duet With Justin Timberlake|last=Rodriguez|first=Jayson|author2=Sway J. Calloway|date=2009-02-06|publisher=[[MTV News]]|accessdate=2009-05-18}}{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/entertainment/6347969.stm|title=Dixie Chicks earn Grammys triumph|date=2007-02-12|work=[[BBC News]]|publisher=BBC|accessdate=2009-05-18}} The song was covered by Irish band [[The Coronas]],{{cite news|url=http://www.mtvblogs.co.uk/mtv-news/the-coronas-another-one-watch-out/1643|title=The Coronas.. another one to watch out for!|author=Laura|date=2009-02-02|publisher=[[MTV International|MTV Blogs]]|accessdate=2009-05-18}} and by British group [[Klaxons]] on [[BBC Radio 1]]'s ''[[Live Lounge]]'' and was included in the B-side of their song "[[It's Not Over Yet]]", which was released in June 2007.{{cite news|url=http://www.mtv.co.uk/artists/klaxons/news/40319-klaxons-interview|title=Klaxons Interview|last=Thorogood|first=Tom|date=2007-06-15|publisher=MTV|accessdate=2009-05-18}} ''[[The Village Voice]]''{{'}}s [[Pazz & Jop]] annual critics' poll voted "My Love" as the fourth best single of 2006; Timberlake's "[[SexyBack]]" and T.I.'s "[[What You Know (T.I. song)|What You Know]]" were voted on the same poll at numbers seven and two, respectively. Additionally, the song won [[American Society of Composers, Authors and Publishers|ASCAP]] Pop Music Awards in the category Most Performed Songs in 2007{{Cite web|url=http://www.ascap.com/eventsawards/awards/popawards/2007/mostperformed.aspx|title = 2007 ASCAP Pop Music Awards Winners List|date = April 18, 2004|accessdate = December 29, 2014|work = ASCAP}} and 2008,{{Cite web|url=http://www.ascap.com/eventsawards/awards/popawards/2008/mostperformedsongs.aspx|title = 2008 ASCAP Pop Music Awards Winners List|date = April 9, 2008|accessdate = December 29, 2014|work = ASCAP}} an ASCAP Rhythm & Soul Award in 2008,{{Cite web|url=http://www.ascap.com/eventsawards/awards/rsawards/2008/hiphop.aspx|title = 2008 ASCAP Rhythm & Soul Music Awards Winners List - R&B/Hip-Hop|date = June 24, 2008|accessdate = June 28, 2015|work = ASCAP}} a [[BMI Awards|BMI Urban Award]] in 2007,{{cite web | url=http://www.bmi.com/news/entry/2007_bmi_urban_awards_bmi_award_winning_songs | title=2007 BMI Urban Awards: BMI Award Winning Songs | work=BMI | date=September 8, 2007 | accessdate=July 10, 2016}} and a BMI Pop Award in 2008.{{cite web | url=http://www.bmi.com/news/entry/2008_bmi_pop_awards_award_winning_songs | title=2008 BMI Pop Awards - Award Winning Songs | work=BMI | date=May 21, 2008 | accessdate=July 10, 2016}} ==Chart performance== "My Love" was commercially successful in the United States. The single debuted at number 89 on September 23, 2006, on the [[Billboard Hot 100|''Billboard'' Hot 100]], prior to its physical release.{{cite news|first=Clover|last=Hope|title=Timberlake in 5th week atop Billboard Hot 100|date=2006-09-29|work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]|publisher=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]}} From number five on November 11, 2006,{{cite web|url=http://acharts.us/song/10997|title=Justin Timberlake featuring T.I. and Timbaland — My Love|publisher=αCharts.us|accessdate=2009-05-18}} it propelled to number one the following week. "My Love" became Timberlake's second consecutive number one hit on the ''Billboard'' Hot 100 from his ''Futuresex/Lovesounds'' album, becoming the first male artist since [[Usher (entertainer)|Usher]] in 2004 to have three or more consecutive number one hits from one album.{{cite journal|first=Fred|last=Bronson|title=Chart Beat - 'Love' Conquers|date=2006-11-02|work=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]}} The single peaked at number one on the Hot 100 for three consecutive weeks. In addition to the Hot 100, "My Love" also reached number one on the following ''Billboard'' charts: [[Pop 100]], ''[[Hot Dance Airplay]]'' and Top 40 mainstream charts, and has peaked at number three on the [[Rhythmic Top 40]]. Also, on the [[Hot R&B/Hip-Hop Songs]], "My Love" peaked at number two to become Timberlake's most successful single on this chart. The song also charted on the [[Hot Dance Club Play]] and Hot Adult Top 40 Tracks charts, peaking at number 15 and number 29, respectively.{{cite web|url={{BillboardURLbyName|artist=justin timberlake|chart=all}}|title=Artist Chart History — Justin Timberlake|work=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]|publisher=Nielsen Business Media, Inc|accessdate=2009-05-18}} "My Love" was certified [[music recording sales certification|Platinum]] by the [[RIAA]] on February 26, 2007,{{cite web|url=https://www.riaa.com/goldandplatinumdata.php?table=SEARCH |title=RIAA Search Database |publisher=Recording Industry Association of America |date=2013-03-20 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070626050454/http://www.riaa.com/goldandplatinumdata.php?table=SEARCH |archivedate=2007-06-26 }} and has sold 2.5 million copies in the US as of February 2018.{{cite web |url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/chart-beat/8097976/justin-timberlake-nsync-career-album-song-sales-ask-billboard|title=Ask Billboard: Justin Timberlake & *NSYNC's Career Album & Song Sales |work=Billboard |publisher=Billboard-Hollywood Media Group |date=February 4, 2018 |accessdate=February 4, 2018 |last=Trust |first=Gary}} In the United Kingdom, "My Love" debuted at number 14 on the [[UK Singles Chart]] on November 12, 2006 (for the week ending date November 18, 2006), one week prior to its physical release, and ascended to its peak the following week at number 2 (having been beaten to the summit by [[Akon]] and [[Eminem]]'s "[[Smack That]]"), to become Timberlake's fourth single to reach the runner up position on the British charts.{{cite web|url=https://www.officialcharts.com/search/singles/Gravity%27s%20Rainbow|title=The Official Charts Company — Justin Timberlake — My Love|date=2006-11-18|publisher=[[Official Charts Company]]|accessdate=2009-05-18}} The digital download sales helped propel the single to number two on November 20, 2006.{{cite news|url=http://www.sonymusic.co.uk/artists/justin_timberlake/4053/50/|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160303190612/http://www.sonymusic.co.uk/artists/justin_timberlake/4053/50/|url-status=dead|archive-date=2016-03-03|title=Justin At Number 2!|date=2006-11-20|publisher=Sony BMG UK|accessdate=2009-05-18}} The song spent nineteen weeks within the top 75, retiring on March 24, 2007, spending four of those within the top ten. The single entered the top five in Germany, Switzerland, Sweden, and Finland, and entered the top ten in France and Austria. In Australia, "My Love" debuted and peaked at number four on the Australian [[ARIA Charts|ARIA]] singles chart on November 26, 2006, gaining the Highest Debut certification.{{cite web|url=http://acharts.us/australia_singles_top_50/2006/47|title=Australia Singles Top 50|date=2006-11-20|publisher=αCharts|accessdate=2009-05-18}} It spent a total of twenty-four weeks on the chart.{{cite web|url=http://acharts.us/song/10997|title=Justin Timberlake featuring T.I. and Timbaland — My Love|publisher=αCharts|accessdate=2009-05-18}} "My Love" was certified [[music recording sales certification|Gold]] by [[Australian Recording Industry Association]] (ARIA).{{cite web|url=http://www.aria.com.au/pages/ariacharts-accreditations-2006singles.htm |title=ARIA Charts — Accreditations - 2006 Singles |year=2006 |publisher=[[ARIA Charts]] |accessdate=2009-05-18 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/5nTGrTknR?url=http://www.aria.com.au/pages/ariacharts-accreditations-2006singles.htm |archivedate=2010-02-11 }} In New Zealand, the single debuted at number 25 and eventually peaked at number one for five non-consecutive weeks, to become Timberlake's second number one single. ==Music video== The [[music video]] for "My Love" was directed by [[Paul Hunter (director)|Paul Hunter]] and premiered on October 23, 2006. The video includes the [[prelude (music)|prelude]] to the song ("Let Me Talk to You"), which includes the song's producer, [[Timbaland]] and features T.I.{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/music/2006/nov/02/popandrock1|title=Justin Timberlake — My Love|last=Pickard|first=Anna|date=2006-11-02|work=[[The Guardian]]|publisher=[[guardian.co.uk]]|accessdate=2009-05-17}} The video incorporates a black-and-white background and dancing, choreographed as the steps are in sync with the beat of the song.{{cite news|url=http://www.tonight.co.za/index.php?fArticleId=3526912&fSectionId=368&fSetId=251|title=Press play — Justin Timberlake|last=Herimbi|first=Helen|date=2006-11-08|work=Tonight|publisher=[[Independent News & Media]]|accessdate=2009-05-19}} [[Image:Justin-timberlake-my-love.jpg|thumb|left|Timberlake with a female dancer in the music video.]] The video starts with "Let Me Talk to You" as the background is surrounded by faulty fluorescent lighting, turning on and off in a programmed pattern. It also begins with Timberlake and Timbaland chanting "hey" to one another. The video proceeds with Timberlake dancing to the beat of the song. Timbaland then begins singing the first verse of the song, which then is proceeded by Timberlake. This is immediately followed with "My Love" playing; the first verse of the song, "Ain't another woman that could take your spot my", plays. Timberlake comes floating toward the camera, down the faulty fluorescent tube. Once Timberlake stops floating, he begins singing the main verse of the song, which violins begin to float swirling gently around him, for "If I wrote you a symphony / Just to say how much you mean to me". The scene then changes with Timberlake and various dancers dancing accordingly in a choreographed style. When Timberlake begins the second verse, "Now if I wrote you a love note / And made you smile at every word I wrote", pens and paper begin to float. This later exceeds with Timberlake singing "This ring here represents my heart" with a ring swirling into the camera. T.I. is then seen in the shot. T.I. begins [[rapping]] his lines in the song. After T.I. finishes his verse, Timberlake is then seen dancing with a female back-up dancer. Though, as they continue dancing, the female then leaves the shot, leaving Timberlake to dance to the end of the song. In the closing moments, the camera swirls around him, proving, conclusively, from every angle, that everyone has gone. At the [[2007 MTV Video Music Awards]], Timberlake won Male Artist of the Year for "Let Me Talk To You/ My Love", "SexyBack", and "What Goes Around ... / ... Comes Around".{{cite news|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1566507/20070807/timberlake_justin.jhtml|title=MTV VMA Race Is On: Justin Timberlake, Beyonce Lead Nominations|last=Montgomery|first=James|date=2007-08-07|publisher=[[MTV News]]|accessdate=2009-05-18}} He, alongside choreographers Blake Anthony and Marty Kudelka, won Best Choreography in a Video for "My Love". ==Live performances== Timberlake performed "My Love" and "[[SexyBack]]" as a medley for the opening of the [[2006 MTV Video Music Awards]],{{cite hosted.{{cite news|url=https://www.usatoday.com/life/music/news/2006-11-02-mtv-europe-awards_x.htm|title=Denmark hosting MTV Europe Music Awards|date=2006-11-02|work=[[USA [[FutureSex/LoveShow]]. "My Love" was performed by Timberlake at the [[2013 MTV Video Music Awards]] on August 25 as part of a medley. The song is featured on Timberlake's 2013/14 [[The 20/20 Experience World Tour]]. The song is also featured on Timberlake’s 2018/2019 [[The Man of the Woods Tour]]. On January 10, 2019, in [[Atlanta]], [[T.I.]] joined him on stage to perform the song.
